channel.title: Whips
channel.description:
When black people say "they got whips", does it mean they play RuneScape and have level 70 attack? Or something else?
0:30. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TclHBIzshHg

item.title: Whips
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:13, topic:423321”][quote author=ohiitsme link=topic=525967.msg3830451#msg3830451 date=1322525662]

When the steering wheel was first put into use in automobiles, it was called the “whip”. The whip is what you used to control the horses on a stagecoach, hence the analogy. Many years later, various hip hop artists noticed that the Mercedes-Benz logo resembled a steering wheel. They then proceeded to use the old term “whip” to describe any Mercedes-Benz vehicle. The term has now been generalized to classify any expensive automobile.

oh so when you say "selling whip, 500k! " i really should be saying “selling whip 18,350$”
[/quote]

NO U FUCKING JACKASS. WHIPS IN RUNESCAPE ARE MUCH DIFFERENT THAN WHIPS IN REAL LIFE. Whips tend to have drugs in them.[/quote]

The slang term “Riding’ Dirty” is the meaning to be driving an authorized automobile with narcotics or any substance inside the automobile.

Read full topic

When the steering wheel was first put into use in automobiles, it was called the “whip”. The whip is what you used to control the horses on a stagecoach, hence the analogy. Many years later, various hip hop artists noticed that the Mercedes-Benz logo resembled a steering wheel. They then proceeded to use the old term “whip” to describe any Mercedes-Benz vehicle. The term has now been generalized to classify any expensive automobile.
[/quote]

oh so when you say "selling whip, 500k! " i really should be saying “selling whip 18,350$”[/quote]

NO U FUCKING JACKASS. WHIPS IN RUNESCAPE ARE MUCH DIFFERENT THAN WHIPS IN REAL LIFE. Whips tend to have drugs in them.

item.title: Whips
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:8, topic:423321”][quote author=The Outsider link=topic=525967.msg3830244#msg3830244 date=1322513948]

[quote author=krackkid link=topic=525967.msg3830242#msg3830242 date=1322513850]

On a serious note, what do they mean?
[/quote]Normally cars I think.

I’m not quite sure of analogy there.
[/quote]Well the lyrics go "Got keys, Got fuel, Got a new whip…So It fits, Although us white people her it this way.

"Got fucking bitch ass keys, got the mother fucking bitching fuel, got me a new fucking mother bitch slap cock slam whip.[/quote]
I lol’d.

t4:

When the steering wheel was first put into use in automobiles, it was called the “whip”. The whip is what you used to control the horses on a stagecoach, hence the analogy. Many years later, various hip hop artists noticed that the Mercedes-Benz logo resembled a steering wheel. They then proceeded to use the old term “whip” to describe any Mercedes-Benz vehicle. The term has now been generalized to classify any expensive automobile.

Oh… now it makes sense! That’s quite clever.

Read full topic

item.title: Whips

item.description:
@T41 wrote:

When the steering wheel was first put into use in automobiles, it was called the “whip”. The whip is what you used to control the horses on a stagecoach, hence the analogy. Many years later, various hip hop artists noticed that the Mercedes-Benz logo resembled a steering wheel. They then proceeded to use the old term “whip” to describe any Mercedes-Benz vehicle. The term has now been generalized to classify any expensive automobile.
